meanings.definition: Pertusses (verb): third person singular present of pertuss
meanings.sent1: He pertusses loudly when he has a coughing fit.
meanings.sent2: She pertusses uncontrollably during the night.
meanings.sent3: The cat pertusses in a funny way whenever it gets startled.
meanings.sent4: The old car engine pertusses like a tired bear waking up from hibernation.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm pertusses through the night, keeping everyone awake.

meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the children with pertusses.
meanings.sent2: There were many cases of pertusses reported in the town.
meanings.sent3: The pertusses in the classroom caused the teacher to take extra precautions.
meanings.sent4: The pertusses of laughter echoed through the hallways.
meanings.sent5: The pertusses of birds chirping signaled the start of a new day.
